project_abstract.cdata: The Second Highway Project's objective is to strengthen the state road network in commercial farming areas as well as in communal lands by reducing the backlog of the periodic maintenance of primary, secondary and feeder roads. The project comprises : (1) strengthening and rehabilitation of nine sections of paved roads totalling 175 km; (2) resealing of about 1500 km of paved roads; (3) regravelling of about 1500 km of secondary and feeder roads; (4) low-cost improvement of about 1400 km of secondary and feeder roads; and (5) consultants to prepare detailed engineering studies and to supervise strengthening and rehabilitation of paved roads.
